alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 7:26PM MST until July 31 at 10:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... Navajo County in north central Arizona... * Until 1030 PM MST /1130 PM MDT/. * At 722 PM MST /822 PM MDT/, National Weather Service Cedar City Doppler radar indicated heavy rain falling from thunderstorms along the Utah border. Storms are in a line from east of Page to the Navajo Mountain Trading Post. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Labyrinth Canyon and Lake Powell. This includes the following slot canyons... Butterfly Canyon, West Canyon Creek, Canyon X and Labyrinth Canyon. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Navajo Creek, Kaibito Creek, Sand Wash, West Canyon Creek, Last Chance Creek, Peach Wash, Chaiyahi Creek and Antelope Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
